reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Improved Water Supply for 45,000 returnees,IDP host populations through well rehabilitation and sewage station re- equipping in AL-Hussainiyah, Bahdaliya Al -Deiyabiah (Rural Damascus and Rural Qunaitrah ).

description.narrative:
Hussainiyah is a southern suburb of Rural Damascus, The town is inhabited by returnees, IDPs ,Palestine refugees and resident community. where sustained humanitarian aid has not been delivered due to access problems Beside many other basic needs, there is an emergency to improve the present WASH conditions: presently, there are severe supply shortfalls and appalling environmental hygiene conditions. HELP proposes to rehabilitate 4 abandoned wells in Hussainiyah, and provide equipment for sewage evacuation plus a sewage conveyor line to an intermediate discharge facility. The project activities addressing the most urgent needs of the beneficiaries Activity 1 : The 4 targeted wells (MOWR denomination ‘Hussainiyah No(.4,5,6,7’) are presently not in operational condition . After rehabilitation and re-equipping ,the water produced from the 4 wells will be pumped into the main water network thus ascertaining the minimum water needs (18.2 ltr / day/ P). This action will secure the safety of households,many of them are female headed households,most vulnerable returnees amp IDPs . Providing direct supplies into their households preventing from more incidents of water- borne diseases and reduce the reliance on unprotected water sources. The basic survival water needs based on Sphere emergency standards are 7.5-15 litres per day. Based on the information from the MOWR wells abundance as following: Well No 4 Water production is 20 m3. Well No 5 Water production is 20 m3. Well No 6 Water production is 20m3 Well No 7 Water production is 22 m3. Total wells water production is 82m3/ hour. Total water production from the four wells 820,000 ltr / day as follows : 10 h x82 m3 x1000 ltr = 820,000 ltr , the wells will operate only 10 hours / day due to shortages in power supply. Target population will receive 18m3 /day/ person, which is beyond 15 ltr specified in sphere standers.
Activity 2: Liquid Waste collection and evacuation for Al Hussainiyah and Dhiabia suburbs used to be operated through sewage pumping into a main waste water conveyor towards an intermediate treatment station . The latter is not operational. HELP will re- equip sewage pumping stations and connect them with a pipeline length over 1,860 lm. The pipeline will discharge into 2 open pits close to the conference Palace. In both pits, suction pumps and ancillary equipment will be installed for a final evacuation into a protected and covered cement channel for final discharge. . This life saving measure will efficiently reduce health risks related to water borne diseases
